author: kolbyml
content: I built an execution state snapshot format called `e2ss` which is built off the `e2store` format `era` and `era1` uses. They only contain 1 blocks worth of state and the file names are `{network}-{block number}-{state root}.e2ss`. With the help of Paul from Devops we have set up a s3 bucket storing some dumps <https://e2ss.ethportal.net/index.html>. Here is a implementation and outline of the format <https://github.com/ethereum/trin/blob/62dd518a88eda8496f89db9f9c149231a2c326dc/e2store/src/era2.rs>

author: kolbyml
content: Our usecase is bootstrapping execution clients, but I am sure there are others.

author: kolbyml
content: `.e2ss` is basically just a flat archival state format

author: kolbyml
content: The format is stream-able as well so you can import state well the snapshot is downloading
